dt: {bc}ability to act or produce an effect
{bc}capacity for being acted upon or undergoing an effect
{bc}legal or official authority, capacity, or right
{bc}possession of control, authority, or influence over others
often used in the phrase {it}the powers that be{/it}
{bc}the number of times as indicated by an exponent that a number occurs as a factor in a product
{bc}a source or means of supplying energy
{bc}the time rate at which work is done or energy emitted or transferred
{bc}the probability of rejecting the null hypothesis in a statistical test when a particular alternative hypothesis happens to be true

pt: {sc}power{/sc} {sc}authority{/sc} {sc}jurisdiction{/sc} {sc}control{/sc} {sc}command{/sc} {sc}sway{/sc} {sc}dominion{/sc} mean the right to govern or rule or determine. {sc}power{/sc} implies possession of ability to wield force, authority, or influence.
{sc}authority{/sc} implies power for a specific purpose within specified limits.

pt.t: granted the {it}authority{/it} to manage her estate

pt: {sc}jurisdiction{/sc} applies to official power exercised within prescribed limits.
{sc}control{/sc} stresses the power to direct and restrain.

pt.t: you are responsible for the students under your {it}control{/it}

pt: {sc}command{/sc} implies the power to make arbitrary decisions and compel obedience.
{sc}sway{/sc} suggests the extent of exercised power or influence.

pt.t: the empire extended its {it}sway{/it} over the region

pt: {sc}dominion{/sc} stresses sovereign power or supreme authority.

{sc}power{/sc} {sc}force{/sc} {sc}energy{/sc} {sc}strength{/sc} {sc}might{/sc} mean the ability to exert effort. {sc}power{/sc} may imply latent or exerted physical, mental, or spiritual ability to act or be acted upon.
{sc}force{/sc} implies the actual effective exercise of power.

pt.t: used enough {it}force{/it} to push the door open

pt: {sc}energy{/sc} applies to power expended or capable of being transformed into work.
{sc}strength{/sc} applies to the quality or property of a person or thing that makes possible the exertion of force or the withstanding of strain, pressure, or attack.

pt.t: use weight training to build your {it}strength{/it}

pt: {sc}might{/sc} implies great or overwhelming power or strength.

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}poer, pouer{/it}, from {it}poer{/it} to be able, from Vulgar Latin {it}*potēre{/it}, alteration of Latin {it}posse{/it} {ma}{mat|potent|}{/ma}
shortdef: ability to act or produce an effect
capacity for being acted upon or undergoing an effect

dt: {bc}to supply with power and especially motive power
{bc}to move about by means of motive power
{bc}to move with great speed or force

shortdef: to supply with power and especially motive power
to move about by means of motive power

dt: {bc}ability to notice and pay close attention to things

dt.t: The author's excellent {it}powers of observation{/it} are evident in the book's detailed descriptions.

shortdef: ability to notice and pay close attention to things

dt: {bc}the people who decide what is allowed or acceptable in a group, organization, etc.

dt.t: The students wanted to have a big party, but {it}the powers that be{/it} didn't approve.

shortdef: the people who decide what is allowed or acceptable in a group, organization, etc.

dt: {bc}usable power (such as heat or electricity) that comes from a renewable or green resource

shortdef: usable power (such as heat or electricity) that comes from a renewable or green resource

dt: {bc}the mobilization of the political and economic power of Black Americans especially to compel respect for their rights and improve their condition

shortdef: the mobilization of the political and economic power of Black Americans especially to compel respect for their rights and improve their condition

dt: {bc}a {d_link|power|power:1} that offsets or checks an opposing power

dt.t: So they gave the {wi}counterpower{/wi} of the veto to the president so he could keep the Congress under control.
The idea is that against power over people, we must exert a {wi}counterpower{/wi} over the oppressors.

It remains to be shown how, in a country claiming to be a democracy, a veritable hidden {wi}counter-power{/wi} operating outside institutional controls … could have grown up at the very center of the state.

shortdef: a power that offsets or checks an opposing power

dt: {bc}one of the nations that figure most decisively in international affairs {bc}{sx|superpower||}

shortdef: one of the nations that figure most decisively in international affairs : superpower

dt: {bc}a person who shows extraordinary skill or expertise in a specified field or endeavor

This use of {it}Jedi{/it} has its origin in the fictional universe of the {it}Star Wars{/it} {d_link|franchise|franchise:1}, where the terms {it}Jedi{/it} and {it}Jedi Knight{/it} refer to a member of an order of mystical warriors who can access and manipulate a pervasive spiritual energy called {it}the Force{/it} to perform supernatural feats.

dt.t: … Schreiber grounds the movie, showing Baron as a newsroom {wi}Jedi{/wi}, an outsider who sees what the homegrown Bostonians missed.
He also sees the role of wine {wi}Jedi{/wi} as challenging what people think they like. If diners are open-minded, they might be pleasantly surprised.

As you can imagine, Mr. Biffo took to Teletext like a swan to water, often being referred to as a Teletext {wi}Jedi{/wi} due to his ability to use Teletext's limited graphical abilities (for want of a better word) to their fullest.
Day five, no bids … oh God, I thought, my {phrase}Jedi powers{/phrase} of selling are failing me.

shortdef: a person who shows extraordinary skill or expertise in a specified field or endeavor
